text: Hello all, I have a design that I need to be turned into Hubl, all is straightforward apart from the Knowledge base section. Apparently, the design of the knowledge base can be slightly modified (I dont know if anything changed in the meantime and I can fully customize it). My main problem is related to display a feed of the latest knowledge base articles on the home page. The website is on <http://domain.com|domain.com> while the knowledge base is on <http://learning.domain.com/knowledgebase|learning.domain.com/knowledgebase> > on the <http://domain.com|domain.com> I need to showcase the most recent articles added on the knowledgebase (similar like I would do it for a blog/blog feed). Please advice. Thank you
Has anyone used Sprocket Rocket pro?
If a plan says 1 HubSpot portal and 10 users, do users usually mean licenses?

Hi there :wave::skin-tone-2: I am part of the team at Sprocket Rocket.

10 users means you can have up to 10 people in your account. But you just get the 1 license/portal

let me know if you have any other questions
Hi Bradley! I just got off call with Miles and I think it was a lot of info handed to me at once for me to process
So with the Live App feature with pro and how we are able to deploy page builds for different clients, each client would have to be under one portal, correct?

yes each client would need their own license.

And then they can all be managed within 1 agency account.
Oh I understand now, thank you! Sprocket has a very supportive team
:blush: we try. Please feel free to DM me if you have any other questions
I am finding the need for the same thing in working with a 3rd party cookie management tool
